website_summaries.verdict: With its kid-friendly design, robust construction, and dependable insulation, this popular thermos is a solid choice for smaller children.
pros: Features a unique rubberized grip that's easier for little hands to open, and a rubberized base that won't slide
Double wall vacuum insulated stainless steel construction keeps foods and liquids warm for up to 5 hours or cold for up to 9
Rugged enough to survive everyday use
cons: Small crevices in the lid can be hard to clean

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. This little thermos is perfect for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. This little thermos is perfect for my 6 year old daughters lunch box. I used it this week for Mac n cheese it was the perfect size and my daughter said it was still warm 4 hours after it was packed. Easy enough for her to open and close by herself too.
customer_reviews.author: BabyRi

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because of the reviews. Wanted something my 5 year old could use easily. Had a replacement sent thinking the first was defective. In both pieces, was unable to screw the lid tight in one go. The lids do not shut at all. This from the Thermos brand? Will now need to get the LunchBots one, which is nearly 2 and a half times the price, but boy does that work well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon13

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I tested it with hot water when I received it. 6 hours later the water is still really hot. That's more than enough time to keep my son's lunch hot until he eats it. The silicon grip on the lid helps opening it easily for a little kid. Im happy with it. I read about mold growing on the rubber seal on the lid, so I got a straw brush to wash the rim of the lid and let it air dry completely after every use.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for school lunch!
customer_reviews.text: Great thermos for packing lunch for my boy in kindergarten! Just make sure to take out the gray gasket in the top when washing or else it can grow mold. It's a great shape and size for little hands- but if it's for little ones, just be sure not to tighten the lid as tight as it can go (as long as you're not packing liquid like soup)...several days this year my son has returned with his lunch untouched because he couldn't open the tightly closed lid. :( I find that if the lid is screwed on just enough that it won't fall off, it is perfect for little hands.
customer_reviews.author: sarrilly

customer_reviews.title: Worst thermos and way too small.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst thermos I have ever seen. It states that it's 10 oz, however it does not appear that way. I could barely fit a few pieces of fish or pasta in it without squishing it down. It might be enough for an infant, but not a child. In addition, the cover is so difficult to align and to open, especially for a child. The rubber gasket in the cover is extremely complicated to remove for washing & to put back in. Also, it only keeps the food lukewarm after just 3 hours. I do not recommend this product. I'm sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Beny

customer_reviews.title: Defective Rubber lid seel
customer_reviews.text: I received this and it was defective. I am waiting for replacement in hopes that the new one will work. I opened the lid and the rubber seel is defective. I attached pictures so everyone knows what to check before using it as it is likely the source of leaking some reviewers have experienced. Will update once I get replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Chs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome awesome
customer_reviews.text: We own 2 and both get hard core use by 2 active careless kids on a daily base for over a year. We pack hot lunches and sometimes the little left over food is still warm 6 hours later when we check it. It keeps food warm enough , I wish they would make a wide mouth divided one, we would by 2 more 😉 and it last forever ... abuse, dishwasher and tiny hands friendly . We are more than satisfied .
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ol.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep the food warmer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of this jar for my daughters due the good reviews . After only one month using these jars, my daughter told me it doesn't work anymore (like the first week) and the food is too cold !! The bottom part is losing and I am afraid to twist it and fell off! I don't know if I can return since I have used for a few weeks ! My return "window" is still open until June ... I will wait to hear from the seller. I don't recommend it. It is really frustrated to pay too much for something that you use for a few times, not even the half or quarter of school period!!
customer_reviews.author: luflorida

customer_reviews.title: My Kid will not eat his food most days we use this because it is so cold by lunch
customer_reviews.text: We were very sad that our kid will not eat his lunch using this about 5 hours later even after sitting in boiling for 15 minutes before I put the food in. So I bought a really cheap one and it works so much better so my older kid uses this one now and just eats the cold food and once and while he says it is a little warm and my other son uses the cheap and says the food is warm and eats it again. Maybe I got a bad one that was not vacuum sealed like others have noted. I will contact the seller and see if they have any suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to be great. I bought 2 of them for our daughters to use for bringing soups to school, but after owning them for a few short months they started to leak. At first it was just one, then the other. We thought maybe we were not tightening them enough, then we thought maybe we're over tightening them? After much trial and error we just gave up. Sadly they just didn't live up to what we had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: No leaks
customer_reviews.text: My daughter periodically uses this for warm lunches at school. It keeps food warm for a very long time. The size is good for a child. We've also used it for tea and other liquids. No leaking, and easy to clean. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great, Great! Great! I recommend this product at a great price! We used for my daughters first year of school(kindergarten) and she did well and loved it! Don’t forget to boil hot water and put inside for 1-3minutes then replace with hot food. Opposite for cold would be that we put the container in the freezer overnight without the lid and put cold jello, etc. inside in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Rani

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when my daughter started school last fall, it's held up with weekly use, dishwasher, & even being left in the lunchbox over the weekend (my favorite! 🙊) Keeps soups/pasta/softer solids at a warmer temp. Usually pack lunches around 6:30am & by 11:30 lunch food is still warm! Would definitely recommend, I have purchased 2 more since then!!
customer_reviews.author: Ereka

customer_reviews.title: Defective lid
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 8 year old who doesn't like school lunch and is tired of my sandwiches. I use it mainly for Mac and Cheese or Chef Boyardee, and I'm happy with the temperature of the food in this thermos. Unfortunately the lid on the product I received is cross threaded. It never screwed on right, either it's crooked or too tight, and the other day it closed too tight and my son couldn't eat his food at school, I had to pry it open with a knife at home (upside being the food was still warm). I bought him a new one from the supermarket.
customer_reviews.author: Jah Studded.

customer_reviews.title: Foogos used to be great.... Not anymore!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the newer foogos. This is the second one that I have purchased in the last few years and on both of them the vacuum seals were defective. The outside of the foogo gets hot and doesn't keep the contents hot. I have been using this one for less than 2 months and it is already useless. I have an older foogo that I purchased about 5 years ago that works perfectly. But the newer ones sadly don't work. I am going to try to return it. Hopefully I can get my money back. I would recommend LunchBots instead.
customer_reviews.author: Arianne Lokuta

customer_reviews.title: nothing special
customer_reviews.text: keeps food warm, not hot, after about 4 hours. I was expecting more. it's just a metal cannister with a lid, no technology that I can see that would keep the food warm beyond what any other aluminum air-tight cannister could do. too costly for the value you get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Food stays hot for a very long time! :)
customer_reviews.text: Boil water in a microwave safe container and pour it into the thermos. Place the lid on it and set a timer for 10 minutes. When the 10 minutes is up, make sure that whatever food you are going to put in it is super hot, then empty the water out and put the food in. It lasts for a LONG time! I do this at 6:30am and my youngest eats lunch at noon, and her food in the thermos is still hot. Best part is that it doesn't make everything else in her lunchbox warm and gross. Her yogurt stays cold from her cold pack and her soup stays hot in her thermos. I couldn't not be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Vlaster

customer_reviews.title: This was really nice for bringing lunch for my daughter when she was ...
customer_reviews.text: This was really nice for bringing lunch for my daughter when she was at daycare/preschool. It kept the food warm enough and it had no spills. I wash this on the top rack of the dishwasher. Fast forward half a year in storage, the rubber had a sticky, gummy feel to it and the lid no longer shuts all the way. Maybe I am putting the rubber back on incorrectly, but no matter what I do, the lid doesn't close all the way. It still doesn't spill, but that tiny gap drives me crazy. Now that she's in K, I may have to upgrade to a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ma

customer_reviews.title: Trapped Water
customer_reviews.text: This product has been wonderful for either hot or cold. The sitter said my daughters lunch was still piping hot and had to let it cool before she could allow her to eat. My only complaint is that somehow water has become trapped in the plastic/rubber bottom piece that hugs onto the stainless steel. I'm not sure how I am going to get the water out as the bottom piece is secured pretty well to the bottom of the thermos. While it doesn't compromise the contents in the container, I certainly do not want mold to grow on my child's food container whether inside or out.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not so hot
customer_reviews.text: I boiled some water left it in there for 10 mins and then tested a piece of chicken and green beans. 11am-4pm. After 5 hours the food was cold. I am going to test it out one more time. If it can at least keep it warm for 3 hours I may keep it. If not it's going back because I need it for a hot lunch at the very least a warm lunch. My kid had trouble opening it, I coached him a bit reminding him left lucy/loosey and he got it open. The size and color were really nice maybe for someone that wants it for cold snacks. Not sure have not tried it for cold foods.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for warm or cold food!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I use these for my children’s lunch and they keep food warm or cold for several hours. I use it for pasta, Mac and cheese, cereal, chicken nuggets, etc. When using for hot food I fill it with hot water and let it sit for several minutes to warm it up. It is easy to clean and dishwasher safe. It also does not leak as long as it is closed correctly. Love these and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mam

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping food warm BUT design has all but "fallen" off only 1.5 months
customer_reviews.text: This product does keep my daughter's lunch warm until her lunch period. BUT we only used this product for 1.5 months and the design just started coming off, once washed it just slides right off. Followed cleaning direction. Not sure why it's peeling...we purchased this for the design. When I need to replace this one, I will go with plain.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Fohl

customer_reviews.title: Love it and highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's lunch and it's awesome! It keeps his food warm for hours, even until after school. While I heat or cook his food, I fill container with hottest tap water to pre-warm it (can't remember if instructions said to do that, but other thermos containers like this we have said to), and that helps keep food warm longer. It's easy to clean (I use a pipe cleaner to clean under the seal and in the groove in the lid). It's nice and lightweight but durable. We've never had a problem with leaking unless lid wasn't on properly. I'd definately buy again and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LTW

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews we knew the best ways to keep food hot. My daughter uses this to bring something hot to school for lunch. She loves it. We've used several times now. I put boiling water in it and let it sit for several minutes, then I put the hot/warm food in there and send it off to school with her. She said the food is about the perfect temperature by the time she eats it. It's easy to clean, I'm just hoping it lasts awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: My daughter will use this until she needs to eat more than it can contain
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed product, easy to clean and doesn't have any grooves where food can get stuck and grow nasty. I microwave her lunch in a microwave safe container, toss it in here, and she says her food is still warm at lunch so I'm guessing it works well. She's happy with, and its easy for her (3 years old) to handle, so its functional for its target audience. After using it M-F over the last 3 months the only wear and tear that's noticeable is the branding fading from the outside of the food jar, but otherwise its still in tip top shape.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Hot home lunches
customer_reviews.text: We use this for hot home lunches for our daughter in school. It works great at keeping the food hot. The only downside is the process to prepare to keep the food hot, which requires you to boil water, fill up the thermos, let it stand for 15min, heat up your food super hot, dumb out the water and add your food. It holds 1 to 1.5 cups of food depending on type. Stick to one cup if doing hot liquids like a soup as it will spill putting on or taking off the lid if to full.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Ribao

customer_reviews.title: Works great, kids love em
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them myself (yet) but my 1st and 2nd graders love having hot lunches at school now. My older one actually used to request "cold pasta" just like we would have cold pizza from time to time lol. Now that we have these..."cold" pasta hasn't come up as a request. Anyway, make sure you prime them with hot water for 5-10 minutes before putting heated food in so that the temp rating holds for the full 5-6 hrs advertised. Works as advertised and seems very sturdy and seals very well. Kids may need help opening containers at lunch...lunch aides/workers up (or just the strong friend in the group)!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for warm lunches!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used one for a year now and now we just purchased another for my niece who is tired of the same old sandwhich type packed lunch. These are perfect for pasta and soups, or any dish that needs to stay warm. It's not piping hot three hours later, but it is warm throughout and makes the dish pleasant to eat. I put very hot water in mine for about 5 minutes and pour/wipe out before adding the very hot food. Close immediately and three hours later we still have warm food. Love this thermos!
customer_reviews.author: texasgirl

customer_reviews.title: Favorite thermos for school lunches
customer_reviews.text: We love this thermos for school lunches. It holds just enough for my 6 and 8 year old daughters. It actually keeps things very warm (hot). They've said a couple times their food at lunch is too hot to eat when they initially open it (I put hot water in it in the morning for a few minutes before putting food in it and that's the trick to keeping their food warm until lunch!). It doesn't leek. Keeps things warm/hot. Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: randy byrne

customer_reviews.title: Best idea for lunches ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was speaking to my cousin about how I felt bad for my daughter because all she got were sandwiches for lunch since kids don't get to microwave their food and she recommended packing lunches in a Thermos. Total game changer! This thermos is small enough to fit in an insulated lunch pale but large enough to hold a children's size bowl from ikea. I typically reheat the leftovers in the morning at 7 and they stay warm until my daughter has lunch at 1230. This has totally brightened my daughters lunch experience. Works amazingly well. I have yet to use it for colder products but I'm sure I won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha angel

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my 7 yr old to take to school
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my 7 yr old to take to school. It keeps my daughters lunch warm for 5 hours. With the black grippy bottom we don't have to worry about sliding on the table and the lid is easy to open as well. I really like the fact that there is just stainless bottom and not another layer of material to worry about liquid getting caught between.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A

customer_reviews.title: Very good Thermus Container.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the durability and leak-proof-ness of this thermos container, but I have been very pleased with it thus far. My 3rd grader has not had any leaks and she's been using it for about two months now. It's compact enough to where it fits snugly into her lunchbox. However, I would probably order a larger size one for a middle school child, since they will be hungrier and probably want to eat more than what this container can fit. But for an elementary school child it suffices. Also, as far as I can tell, this thing is dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: AKP

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 year old uses this for warm-hot lunches. She has SPD and several food allergies. This has saved us this school year. This is the first year she is actually eating enough at school! Boy is it making a huge difference in her day!! I boil water in an electric kettle, leave it in the thermos for 10+ minutes with the lid on, heat up her food - as hot as I can, and ta da HOT lunch. I clean it out daily and leave it out to air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent thermos. I use it to put McCann's steel ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent thermos. I use it to put McCann's steel cut Irish oatmeal in after dinner with hot water and by breakfast the oats are perfectly cooked without having to go through a long cooking process. Serve with brown sugar and buttermilk. A Martha Stewart suggestion about the thermos. I buy with gift points and if you wait till you are ordering stuff worth over $25, shipping is free. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: bookworm71

customer_reviews.title: Ok to use for a couple hours only
customer_reviews.text: The jar did not work well for the timeframe I needed hot food. food was just lukewarm after 5 hours in a preheated thermos with the food piping hot and completely full with no airspace. The adult sized thermos food jar for my oldest kept the food so hot in his lunch that he almost burnt his tongue... so the quality of this foogo food jar is not at all up to normal thermos-brand standards.
customer_reviews.author: Hoblet

customer_reviews.title: Great thermos
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional thermos'. We bought two - one for each of my twin daughters as they started kindergarten. They keep soups and liquids plenty hot for hours, but they are difficult for the girls to open. Unless the child has an adult to assist, I would recommend this for 2nd or 3rd graders on up. It's a super cute design though, and again...they food is hot even hours after sealing the thermos. We do follow the manufacturers recommendations and make sure to condition the thermos with each use by adding boiling water for a few minutes and then we dump the water and add our soup/liquid...works great. It's also a good portion size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, keeps food warm, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my 3 year old son to bring to preschool in his lunchbox with his chicken nuggets and mac and cheese since he's a picky eater. They keep everything perfectly warm until lunch time and the size is perfect, too. I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Nicoli B.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe by made Thermos but doesn't act like Thermos.
customer_reviews.text: Not as happy with this as I thought I would be. I needed a smaller thermos to put into my husband's lunch for hot vegetables. I heated everything up as per instructions. My husband doesn't like his food to be real hot when he eats anyway so I was hoping that his green beans would at least be warm. Nope he says they were cold. I have the Thermos King Food jars(16 and 24 oz). and love them. But I really need something smaller than 16 oz. Maybe better for holding something like salad.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Haven't packed this in a lunchbox yet, but I did a test with hot water. The water was still VERY hot 12 hours later. Will definitely work for packing kids' lunches. Little difficult to open for kids, but if you teach them to hold it firmly on the table, they'll be fine. My almost kindergartener can open it easily, now.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Balseca

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't leak. Won't keep things hot or warm long
customer_reviews.text: Positives: It didn't leak. My daughter loved the bright colors (just as pictured). Negatives: Even following the manufacturer's directions of warming the thermos before adding the food it was cold 4 hours later. It also creates a very strong suction that my 5 yr old couldn't open without help from her teacher.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: The very first thing I did when the thermos arrived ...
customer_reviews.text: The very first thing I did when the thermos arrived was to put almost boiling hot water in it, put the lid on, and turn it upside down in the sink. I left it there for about 5 hours before checking. No leaks, and the water was still faintly steaming. I put hot water it in while heating my daughter's soup or mac'n'cheese to keep the food hot (recommend). The only thing I wasn't fond of was the seal on top. I can never tell for sure if there is an up or down to it when I need to wash it, but I haven't had any seal issues so it must be working.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good medium size and keeps food very warm - if you pre-heat it!
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick for school lunches. Good size for a medium portion and fits in my 10 y/o daughters soft sided lunch box. I pre heat the thermos (with really hot water) so it’s already hot when I add the soup, mac-n-cheese or pot stickers. This way the food stays very warm until lunch. If you don’t pre heat it, the food cools down faster. Transformed our school lunch options!!
customer_reviews.author: jrm37'fugitive

customer_reviews.title: Great for packing school lunches
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thermos for packing my daughters warm school lunches in. I put soup or pasta (hot) in here in the morning and it’s still warm for her at lunch time. It washes out very easily and has stood up well to being run through the dishwasher and dropped countless times. The color combo of green and pink is super cute. I will definitely order more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MamadoesitbestTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought two of these exact same thermoses from Amazon, and I loved them. They kept food hot, and there was no transference of heat to the outside surface. The third one I bought was completely different. It looked the same, but it didn’t close correctly. The kid is always at a tilt. Additionally, there is lots of transference of heat to the outside. My kid says his food is never even warm when he eats it. I’m not sure what to do. Order another one and hope it’s lije the first two? I bought the 3rd a while back so am guessing I can’t return/exchange
customer_reviews.author: SF Twin Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and kept my son’s spaghettios nice and warm all ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and kept my son’s spaghettios nice and warm all morning (during colder months in WA) through to his lunch time! My son is a picky eater and never wants to buy a warm lunch at school so this wS the perfect solution! Just be sure to remove the rubber seal when you throw it in the dishwasher to ensure it’s clean for the next use. I read reviews prior to purchasing where there were issues observed with the seal in terms of mold, but we haven’t experienced that issue likely because we remove it each time.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Heat up thermos with hot water, before adding food.
customer_reviews.text: My kid has been using this thermos for a couple of weeks. Very happy with the temp of food by lunchtime. Around 6 1/2 hours after food is added to thermos, the food is just the right temp.... which is a little more than warm. Not piping hot but she wouldn’t eat it that way anyway. She’s taken soup, spaghetti & beef teriyaki with rice, all deliciously many hours later. Going to purchase two more.
customer_reviews.author: J. C

customer_reviews.title: just wish they company gave it a better threading so the lid could be secured without having ...
customer_reviews.text: It keeps food hot for about 4 hours. The threading for the cap is such that if you screw the lid on and try to screw it on tightly.... it jumps out of the threading and you have to try again to re-screw it on. It works for my purpose... just wish they company gave it a better threading so the lid could be secured without having it pop off if you try to tighten it.
customer_reviews.author: Justagirl

customer_reviews.title: lunchtime just got bigger!
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research on these products. I wanted to expand what my kids could eat for lunch. Follow these instructions: Fill with boiling water (the hottest you can get) to the inside ridge. Leave it for 10 minutes. After you open and drain, quickly put the top back on. If your food can stain or stick: spray with cooking oil before your food. Add your food (get it to a hot almost boiling). I have put hot dogs in water for my son. It really is best that it is a liquid based food. Hope this helps!!!
customer_reviews.author: k.t.harrison

customer_reviews.title: Strong, easy to clean. Easy for kid to open.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. No complaints. While I’m warming the food to put in the container I put some boiling water inside to get it nice and warm for the food. Easy for our kid to open by themselves. Simple and quick. The time it takes for the hot water to boil and warm up container, the food it hot! Now if I can only get our kid to eat all the food in the container!
customer_reviews.author: christine neal

customer_reviews.title: Lid problems if contents are too hot
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay container. I use it for transporting hot water for heating baby bottles on the go, and if the water is too hot, after you put the lid on the gasket will pop itself partially out if the lid, meaning that there is a high potential for hot contents leaking everywhere. Be cautious that this jar remains upright until you are familiar with its eccentricities. Since I mostly use it for moving hot (not boiling) water around the house without the lid, it serves it's purpose as a diy bottle warmer. I use it with Dr. Brown's standard bottles and Avent Classic bottles. Avent Naturals do not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids to take to school and I've been very happy with it. I do take the extra step of boiling water to warm the container before adding food and it keeps their food warm for about 3.5-4 hours. I haven't had to test it for times longer than that, but it's opened up a lot more options for their home lunches. It's easy to clean - it might be dishwasher safe, but I hand wash it - and over the months we've used it I haven't noticed any lingering odor at all. It's compact enough that it fits well in their lunchbox, but it holds a full serving or three of food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have used this almost daily for a half a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this almost daily for a half a year to take warm food in a ziplock sandwich bag to my toddler's daycare. It holds up very well for that purpose. It can only fit one small portion of food, so I also purchased the larger size which can old two food items (in sandwich bags).
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Kitties

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver and budget saver
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. We are busy and on the go family. I was tired of buying food out and feeding my children unhealthy food. Once we got these that issue was DONE. We fill these up with food from home and away we go. Kids can eat a healthy meal on the go and life is good. We love hot soups in our family so this works perfectly. Seemed a bit pricey to me at first, but no leaks and they have already paid for themselves with the meals we are not buying out any longer. I'm 100 satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mommap

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure you take the seal ring off to clean or it will get gross. Keeps food temp for long periods of time well.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana E

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Thermos
customer_reviews.text: This thermos has been a lunch life saver for my son. He is not allowed to use a microwave at school so we decided to try this for our leftovers. He had told me that the food is still warm when he goes to lunch, which is about 5 hours after I have packed it that morning. It is a smaller thermos, but it is perfect for his food portions at 11 years old. We will be upgrading to a larger one once in middle school to help keep up with his appetite. It has not leaked for him.
customer_reviews.author: selenarp

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my two daughters who are in college. They work great! The two thermoses hold exactly half a can of a prepared 10 oz can of Cambell's soup. I first fill the two thermoses with boiling water while I make the soup. Next, I simply pour out the hot water and fill with hot soup. I put this together early in the morning and the soup stays hot even until dinner time. Nice when you have an evening class. Note: This only holds one bowl of soup, which is plenty for my girls but you might want the bigger thermos if you are feeding growing boys.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had this thermos for 5 years and still in great condition and keep foods warm still. High quality. I definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Panter

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food warm until lunch
customer_reviews.text: My son used it for the first time for lunch yesterday and it was a success! For reference this thermos will hold about 3/4 of a can of Chef Boy R Dee. Wish it was a tiny bit larger because my middle schooler could eat the whole can. I just packed him some Veggie Straws to go with it and he was happy. He said it was still warm when it was lunch time and he liked it so much that he has already asked me to buy him more spaghetti so he can bring it for lunch again.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyflower

customer_reviews.title: Eventually you will cross thread the top
customer_reviews.text: Originally, this worked well. But the combination of loose/soft thread design and plastic-against-stainless will cause you to cross thread the top. And it will be nearly impossible to get open. Once cross threaded, you've created a pathway for another occurrence. Too bad, otherwise ok. Not recommended for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Allan S Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lunches and little hands.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and works perfectly in my daughters lunch. Its large enough to hold enough to fill her up but not too big and bulky to use to hold a hot side not main dish. It's also easy enough for her to open without waiting for someone to help her.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Free

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a warm breakfast
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the road for work and couldn't figure out how to take a warm breakfast with me. This thermos is perfect! It has more than enough room for a one egg omelet and a piece of sausage patty. It could probably hold double that. I cook the breakfast food and cut it into pieces and put in the thermos. It doesn't get mushy or glop all together. It keeps the food reasonably warm for about 3 hours. Definitely warm it up before you put your food in it. I fill it with hot water and let it sit for about 5 minutes. I'm sure the food would stay warmer longer if I used boiling water though.
customer_reviews.author: Tea drinker

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids
customer_reviews.text: Color is true, small - easily fits into a kid's lunch. Simple to clean, usually just put a few drops of liquid soap into it, add water, put the lid on, give some shakes, rinse, and it's good to go. Keeps things cold / hot for maybe 3-4 hours. Internal temperature doesn't bleed through to your hand. Have dropped it several times - no problems. Like the fact that it is stainless steel; trying to get away from using plastic. Got the lid stuck on one time from some strange liquid vacuum suction.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Great small thermos
customer_reviews.text: This is a great thermos. I've been using it daily for the month to transport milk every morning to work. The milk stays cold, and the screw-on top has creates a seal. The thermos has a sturdy feel to it. My only caveat: It's not very big. If you put, say, soup in there, it would be more a cup than a bowl. But if you're looking for a smallish thermos, this is a great one.
customer_reviews.author: JustADad

customer_reviews.title: ... the three Thermos Foogo's I bought for my 3 great grandsons DOES NOT keep food hot
customer_reviews.text: Talked with my grand daughter today and she said the three Thermos Foogo's I bought for my 3 great grandsons DOES NOT keep food hot. They are all so disappointed, as they like to have hot food for school lunches. Now I don't know what to look for that will fit in their lunch boxes.
customer_reviews.author: nancytex

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect size and fits great in my sons lunch bag
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size and fits great in my sons lunch bag. He said the food is still warm/not too hot at lunch. The chicken nugget on the bottom tends to get a little squishy from condensation but everything else has worked perfect. I've packed spaghetti, sloppy joes, hot dogs, rice, sausage etc with great results! Only complaint would be that the rubber gasket in the lid somehow got folded when we received it so my 5 year old sometimes has a hard time getting the kid on straight. I haven't used it for liquids yet but I don't think it would make it leak.
customer_reviews.author: Jami Cloutier

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: These are really awesome. I bought them to help jeep my daughters food warm/cold for daycare because they dont heat up or refrigerate food there. I tested them at home by making my daughter some pierogies. I boiled them and drained them then put them inside my thermos container and they were still warm 3 hours later. I highly recommend these. They do great.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Paine

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, dishwasher safe and leak proof product!
customer_reviews.text: This is stainless steel top quality and dish washer safe. This is BPA Free. It does keep the food temperature for a good time so I would rate the insulation great. I also like the design. It is definitely leak proof and I am super pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Debora B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for school lunches!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use in my children's lunches since the only sandwiches they really eat are PB&J. This is great for sending hot dogs, chicken nuggets, etc to school and keeping them warm. My son says his food is still warm when it's lunch time! I just boil water and then put it in the thermos for 5 mins, dump the hot water out and put in whatever food I am sending with them. They work great, seal tightly and fit in a regular sized lunchbox!
customer_reviews.author: K. Motes

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep food hot long enough
customer_reviews.text: This thermos is well made and durable, it just doesn't keep food hot long enough for me to make it in the morning, and it still be hot for my son at 10:45am, when he goes for lunch. I did chicken nuggets and soup. I followed the directions and did a test run on both of them at home. Both of them were barely lukewarm in the 3.5-4 hours. It did not meet our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Turner

customer_reviews.title: keeps food warm
customer_reviews.text: Great for daycare! Keeps food warm enough for my baby to have during lunch (about 6 hours?). I agree with another poster--if you don't want mold to grow then remove the rubber ring when you wash the container! It's an extra step, but I've done this for all our thermos and haven't had any problem with mold.
customer_reviews.author: Jades

customer_reviews.title: Works really good
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Keeps good hot for hours. I put hot food in it at 7:00 and eat at 1:00 and food is perfect. Bought six years ago for daughters school lunch but now I use for work. Will be buying more so that each family member has one.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Older version of thermos keeps food Warmer longer
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t keep food warm all that long. The older version thermos was much better at keeping food warmer for a longer period of time. The inside opening is kind of sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: Did not stay hot. Put boiled water in container and let sit for 10 mins and then put hot food in container and let sit for 4 hours. After four hours the food was barely warm. Probably would have been the same temperature if I just left out at room temperature. Waste of money and time. Tested it 3 times with soup, pasta and a hamburger hotdish and same result each time.
customer_reviews.author: kswan24

customer_reviews.title: Greatly insulated, no leak thermos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermos for my daughter's school lunch. She is very happy with this. I pack the lunch early morning and It keeps food very warm until lunch time. It is leak proof, I did not have any problem soups leaking or anything like that. It has one more plus point, which is steel interior. No plastic inside. I always wash in dishwasher and it is as good as new. Nicely put design too. This is my third container. Pretty happy with my purchase. I wish I could get this container in the shape of sandwich box also. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: School Lunches-much improved!
customer_reviews.text: This thermos is great! I use it for daughter's school lunches and it has been a game changer! I can now send mac and cheese, spaghetti, soups, etc. and the thermos keeps them warm until lunch time. You will no be disappointed this thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Superhero3

customer_reviews.title: but the seal is really tight which we like. Our daughter just asks an adult to open ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my kindergartener. She loves it and says it keeps her food warm till lunch time which has it in the thermos for about 4 hours. I did some tests at home and it does keep food warm. We only use it for thicker things so I'm not sure how well soup would do... but the seal is really tight which we like. Our daughter just asks an adult to open it for her. If you follow the instructions it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: The best! I’ll put hot food in this thermos early ...
customer_reviews.text: The best! I’ll put hot food in this thermos early in the morning for my son’s lunch and it’s still nice and hot 4 hours later when he eats at school. It has held up remarkably well! My husband took it on a hunting trip and it kept his food very warm even when trekking through cold temps and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H

customer_reviews.title: The lid gets stuck on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use for school lunches but every once in a while the lid gets stuck on. I found out today that it took two teachers to try and open it for her and they couldn’t do it. I will never use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin M

customer_reviews.title: Does not leak! Keeps warm!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product!! My son has been using this for over a year and has not disappointed either of us!! I put oatmeal, soups, burritos, rice, chicken nuggets and steak in there and it does not leak. The temperature of the food seems to stay warm by the time he uses it at lunch time. Just make sure to put hot water for a couple of minutes to warm up metal before adding the hot food. I sometimes wrap burritos in foil before adding them in container and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: LiLop

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic thermos for lunches!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised, easy to clean, perfect for both of my kids lunches! So far I've sent mac-&-cheese, pasta alla vodka, and rice with broccoli and meatballs and they've all stayed warm and were huge hits with the kids. Now my husband wants one of these, too!
customer_reviews.author: How Roode

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave home with out it!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Love, love, love!! I take them everywhere food stays warm and no leaks! It helps me save money by not eating out and I pack for myself and my two children. It’s better than having to pack cold meals. Warm meals are best and the kids love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Let's start with the pros. It does not mean. Easy to clean. Easy to store. Fits well in the water bottle area of my daughter's backpack. Cons: does not retain heat well. To help with heat retention I fill up the thermos with really hot water for a few minutes so the thermos absorbs some initial heat. After disposing the water & wiping it down I refill with the hot food.... & I make sure it's very hot. Despite that my daughter says her food is warm but not hot.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lovely

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep contents warm at all
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to keep contents warm at all. My daughter complained that her food wasn't warm at lunchtime (2-3 hours after packing in the morning). I ran a simple test, and put hot water into the thermos, closed it tight, and just after two hours, I checked the water inside. It was already at room temperature. Does not keep contents warm at all... certainly not for "5 hours" as the product claims. Fail! :(
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for kid lunchbox
customer_reviews.text: We've had this now for 2 years and it continues to work great. Before we put food in this thermos we will heat it up for 10 minutes with boiling water. Yes, an extra step, but it helps keep the food hot for over 8 hours. We place soups, chili and other hot items in this container for our child's lunch. It fits great in the lunchbox. Our child complained one day that the soup was too hot at lunchtime! Perfect! This thermos has spent a lot of time in a lunchbox and backpack and is holding up very well. I also took this thermos along with two others ice fishing. My food remained hot out on a frozen lake.
customer_reviews.author: Zanke

customer_reviews.title: Just what i want - No plastic, non reactive body for food
customer_reviews.text: I hate plastic around food. I make sure no plastic touches any warm food, so this was perfect for my kids. The lid is still plastic so need to ensure the bottle is standing straight. Also the lid has narrow corners, so cannot easily hand wash it. Best is to wash in a dishwasher and it is dishwasher safe!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vj

customer_reviews.title: Once the food is super warm, i dump out the water and add ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is loving this for her lunches. She is a huge fan of leftovers! I pour boiling water in and seal it up for about 5 minutes while i am heating up whatever she wants for lunch. Once the food is super warm, i dump out the water and add the food. It stays warm till she eats lunch 4 hours later. Haven't tested it to see exactly how long it will stay warm but we love it for lunches!
customer_reviews.author: The Youngs

customer_reviews.title: Love this thermos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughters lunch. I never use it to keep things cold but I know it keeps things hot. I always fit it wil scalding hot water for about 5 minutes, dump the water out then put the food in the thermos. My daughter eats almost 5 hours later and she says her food is always still warm!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda J

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermos and will be getting another one. I was skeptical that it would actually keep foods cold for up to 7 hours and hot for 5 hours. IT really does. I put milk in it and took it to the zoo with us. It was 95 degrees that day and we were there for whole day and it was still cold when i poured it into my sons cup for a drink on the way home. I haven't tested the hot side of it, but my older son has never complained that his lunch is cold after 4 hours in his lunch box!
customer_reviews.author: D. K

customer_reviews.title: Their products are great quality and holds the temp of the food
customer_reviews.text: Foogo is a reputable brand and rightfully so. Their products are great quality and holds the temp of the food. If you put boiling water into the thermos for 10 minutes then pour it out prior to putting the hot food, it will keep the food warmer than if you just put hot food into it. I haven't tried putting ice in prior to putting in cold food but I imagine it would work the same although I don't think this step is necessary since it will keep the food warm for at least 5 hours. Haven't had food in there longer than that so can't comment on 7 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kawibunga

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my kids to take hot lunches to school and they're perfect. I can use boiling water to heat them up in the morning and they'll keep chicken nuggets or pasta warm all day! My kids love them!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Keeps daughters lunch warm for hours!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a Kindergartner, and I've made her soups & mac & cheese, and all have stayed warm for her to enjoy several hours later for her lunch at school. (From when I make it, to her lunch - it's roughly 3 1/2 to 4 hours.) Only thing that I quickly learned was to "pre-warm" it with hot water for about 5-10 minutes before putting hot food in. Worked wonders. (I use the hot water from our Keurig. Simple.) She loves the colors, I love that it's convenient, easily packs in her lunch bag, keeps her food warm, and is easy to clean. Win-win. I'll be buying a blue one for her brother soon! :)
customer_reviews.author: Princess Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Not great for keeping food hot
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't really maintain the heat as I would like it to. It says on the packaging that it holds the heat for at least five hours. Not quite that long. By the time my daughter eats her lunch (around 11:30, when her food has been in it for four), her container with her food is at best, coo, but not quite cold. I have yet to find a container that can keep food hot for her. The container is easy to open for her, and it will keep food cold.
customer_reviews.author: cicisbo

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep items cold nor hot!!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Doesn't keep anything cold and doesn't keep hot food hot. Might as well use Tupperware. I've even tried to put it in the freezer to help with keeping my food cold....Nope!!! Tried soaking it in hot water to keep my good hot.....Nope. WASTE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this thermos the first few times that I used ...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this thermos the first few times that I used it. I do a lot of work in the community and often eat my lunch in my car between meetings, I thought this would be perfect. Worked great the first few times, I followed the washing directions and always washed by hand, around the 5th time I used it, the lid got vacuum sealed on somehow and I could not get it off. I would twist it and it would make a popping noise and be closed again. Ended up having to throw it out because I could never get it open and it had soup still in it.
customer_reviews.author: sarah lawn

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep food warm at all.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to bring hot lunch to school. It's supposed to keep food warm for 4-5 hours, but when my daughter opened this Foogo 3 hours after I packed it, she said the food was ice cold! I had to return it. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Keeps liquids hot.... really, really, really hot!  Yay!
customer_reviews.text: We really have to be careful with this one. If I heat up my child's soup too much, his soup will still be boiling hot 4 hours later at lunch time! This Thermos does a GREAT job... sometimes too great of a job, but that's a good thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and size
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product every day for 2 weeks now and the thermos works great and is great quality. The food stays warm from ~7 am until ~ noon (5 hours) when I eat my lunch. There has been no issues leaking. The rubber gasket is a little difficult to get out to clean but not enough to make me dislike the product. Would recommend to anyone. Its a perfect size for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie M

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mom so happy to know our daughter has a warm, home-cooked lunch!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the BEST lunch thermos! I bought this for our daughter who loves eating soups and having a warm lunch during her long school days. It is really nice to know she is getting a nice warm home-cooked meal for lunch. The soup stays really warm, in fact one day it was almost too hot for her to eat! It does not spill.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to put in the kids lunch boxes.it kept the food warm until lunch. We are so excited for this to get this and give the kids some variety for lunch. I like the wide opening at the top and I also like the size of it. I used it again today and packed my son spaghetti. It was nice and warm when he went to eat it. I would reccommend this product to others
customer_reviews.author: Ryan & Alicia

customer_reviews.title: This is great for packing mac n cheese
customer_reviews.text: This is great for packing mac n cheese. I found it helps to boil water and pour that in while I'm cooking the food that's going in there. It helps to keep it warm. I will say if you try to put something in there that isn't going to fill it to the top, it probably won't stay warm. I tried to cook up a hot dog for her and she said it was cold by lunchtime. But the mac n cheese says nice and warm!
customer_reviews.author: Jen D

product_meta.title: Thermos Foogo Vacuum Insulated Stainless Steel 10-Ounce Food Jar, Watermelon/Green
product_meta.description: Color:Watermelon/GreenLong considered a trusted partner by parents for providing a way to bring healthy food and drink options for kids on the go, Genuine Thermos Brand has brought its superior insulation technology to FOOGO, a line of children's products for ages six months and older. Freshness and safety go hand in hand. If contents are not kept at the right temperature, potentially dangerous bacteria may grow rapidly and cause food and beverages to spoil. All FOOGO stainless steel products feature THERMOS vacuum insulation technology which has been shown to inhibit the growth of bacteria in a laboratory test sponsored by Thermos and performed by Cornell University. For additional peace of mind FOOGO products use BPA-free materials. Thermos brand food jars are beloved by families for their ability to keep food warm or cold on the go. Now there is a food jar for the smallest members of the household. The FOOGO food jar has a 10-ounce capacity and features THERMOS vacuum insulation technology which will keep warm items warm for up to 5 hours or cold items cold for up to 7 hours. Thanks to the durable double wall stainless steel construction and vacuum insulation, this food jar stays cool to the touch with warm foods and sweat-proof with cold foods. The FOOGO food jar features an ergonomically-designed lid with a rubber grip that is easy to handle and open. It has a wide opening making it easy to fill, eat from and clean. Ideal for packing fresh, healthy foods and snacks, the FOOGO food jar is sure to become a favorite on-the-go meal companion. Care is simple: to clean, hand washing is recommended for best results, or top-rack dishwasher safe.
feature_bullets: THERMOS FOOGO double wall stainless steel food jar features THERMOS vacuum insulation technology that keeps contents cold for up to 7 hours or warm for up to 5 hours; Vacuum insulation maintains temperature of the contents longer, which inhibits bacteria growth and spoiling

The FOOGO food jar was designed with kids in mind: the stainless steel interior and exterior is durable and withstands the demands of daily use; The double wall design allows this food jar to stay cool to the touch with warm foods and sweat-proof with cold foods

Food jar is compact and portable and features a 10-ounce capacity - perfect for toddlers on the go; The food jar's ergonomically-designed lid has a rubber grip for easy handling; The base of the jar is non-slip and scratch resistant
The wide opening of the THERMOS FOOGO food jar is easy to fill, eat from and clean; It is a great way to pack fresh and healthy meals for school or on the go
Simple care: hand wash (preferred) or top-rack dishwasher safe; All THERMOS FOOGO items are made from BPA-free materials
